description: A 1972 rape survivor, whose case led to landmark legal reforms, was found living in dire conditions. A TOI report sparked immediate action from Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis and widespread support from across India and abroad. Authorities have pledged financial aid, housing, and rations, offering a lifeline to the woman known as 'Mathura'.

title: Trump to release MRI results, but he doesn’t know which body part was scanned – watch
description: US President Donald Trump stated he is willing to release the results of an October MRI scan, describing them as "perfect." Trump further told reporters he has “no idea” which part of his body the MRI covered. The White House has not clarified the purpose or body part scanned, only confirming it was part of a routine physical.

Despite the government's non-committal stance, parties are united, threatening to stall proceedings if their concerns aren't addressed. Other issues like national security and air pollution were also raised.

description: Yuzvendra Chahal celebrated Virat Kohli's record 52nd ODI century with enthusiastic social media posts. Kohli's masterful 135 guided India to a commanding total against South Africa. Chahal's playful messages highlighted Kohli's potential pursuit of Sachin Tendulkar's milestone, showcasing their close bond and the spinner's unfiltered joy in celebrating his "Virat bhaiya's" achievements.

title: PAK vs SL: 'Not allowed to go out' — Sri Lanka captain's revelation after Pakistan blast
description: Sri Lanka's cricket tour of Pakistan faced security concerns after a bomb blast in Islamabad, leading to player apprehension. Extensive military security measures were implemented, ensuring the team's safety. Despite restrictions, captain Dasun Shanaka expressed gratitude to the PCB and security forces, acknowledging batting challenges and looking forward to future tours.

title: Trinamool Congress accuses Election Commission of India of leaking info to BJP leaders
description: From day one, Suvendu Adhikari and other BJP leaders have created a sense of fear among common people by repeatedly claiming that one crore names will be removed from the voter list in the state, TMC MP Partha Bhowmik said

title: ‘Govt steps in’: Centre backs flyers in SC fight; Delhi, Mumbai operators face Rs 50,000cr hit
description: The Indian government will back the Airports Economic Regulatory Authority of India (AERA) in a Supreme Court battle against Delhi and Mumbai airport operators. The case concerns a Rs 50,000-crore claim for hypothetical regulatory asset base, which could lead to significant hikes in passenger charges if awarded to the operators.

A wall that connects, in a flood that’s wrecked life and livelihood
description: More than three months after floods submerged this village and large parts of the State, reptiles and insects, some poisonous, now live in the water, making this strip of wall both a lifeline and a hazard for these families.

title: '1983 Nellie killings not communal': Assam makes Tewary report public; 41 years after submission
description: A 41-year-old report by the Tribhuvan Prasad Tewary Commission, recently made public by the Assam government, reveals that successive administrations allowed the state's "land and identity crisis" to worsen. The report, which investigated the 1983 Nellie massacre, identified illegal immigration and land disputes as key drivers of violence, not just communal clashes.

title: Pune: Drunk IT professional rams car into pub’s parking, valet attendant dead
How a high-carbohydrate diet increases risk of lung cancer
description: New research suggests a link between high glycemic index (GI) diets and an increased risk of lung cancer, even in non-smokers. A large study found individuals consuming the highest GI foods had a significantly higher incidence of lung cancer. This association highlights how rapid blood sugar spikes may impact lung tissue over time, independent of traditional risk factors.

title: Haryana govt removes top sports officers after deaths of 2 athletes
‘To curb cyber fraud’: Govt tightens app security; WhatsApp, Telegram to enforce SIM link
description: New government orders mandate communication apps like WhatsApp and Telegram to enforce stricter login protocols.  Users will face automatic logouts from desktop versions every six hours, requiring QR code re-authentication.  Smartphone access will also be restricted to the original SIM card used for registration, aiming to curb cyber fraud and enhance security.

title: Divyanshi bags U15 TT bronze, U19 boys' team settles for silver
description: In the semifinals, Divyanshi Bhowmick went down fighting against China's Zhu Qihui 4-1 (12-10, 10-12, 6-11, 4-11, 8-11) to settle for a bronze

title: Elon Musk warns against firms ‘gaming’ H-1B system but opposes visa shutdown
EC extends SIR deadline by a week, it's Dec 11 now
description: The Election Commission has extended the SIR Phase 2 timeline by a week across 12 states and UTs to ensure electoral roll transparency. This move follows reports of alleged malpractices, allowing booth level officers more time to share elector lists with political parties. The extended period aims to prevent errors and build trust before the final roll publication.

title: Puligilla-Sherif becomes first Indian pair to finish on WRC3 podium
description: Competing in the WRC3 category at the Saudi Arabia Rally 2025, Naveen Puligilla and Musa Sherif finished second in their class

title: India's A320 fleet finishes software fix in just over a day
description: Indian airlines IndiGo, Air India, and Air India Express successfully reverted flight-control software on 323 Airbus A320 jets to a safer 2022 version. This rapid rollback averted widespread groundings after Airbus identified a potential loss of control issue during intense solar storms. Carriers experienced minimal disruption, with only minor cancellations and delays.

title: Senthilkumar, Anahat start favourites in HCL Squash Indian Tour 4
description: The $15,000 PSA Challenger event features a mix of international and domestic contenders, including the experienced Joshna Chinappa, a former women’s world No. 10, and men’s world No. 51 Veer Chotrani

title: West Ham great Billy Bonds dies aged 79
description: Billy Bonds played 799 times for West Ham during a 21-year spell between 1967-88, captaining the East London side to FA Cup victories in 1975 and 1980

title: Para-athlete attacked for taking on group harassing women dies
description: A national-level bodybuilder and para-athlete from Rohtak, Rohit Dhankhar, died after being attacked for confronting men harassing women at a wedding. Dhankhar was severely beaten by a group of nearly 20 armed assailants after the wedding ceremony. His family alleges it was a planned murder for standing up for women's dignity.

title: 'Payment for betrayal is death': Man stabs wife over extramarital affair; posts selfie with body
description: A 32-year-old man murdered his estranged wife at a women's hostel in Coimbatore, stabbing her to death over an alleged extramarital affair. He then took a selfie with her body and posted it on WhatsApp with a vengeful message. The accused has been arrested by the Rathinapuri police.

title: Shifting visa pattern: H-1B nod for IT firms drops to 4.5k - lowest in a decade
description: Top Indian IT firms saw a significant 70% drop in H-1B initial employment approvals for FY 2025. Tech giants like Amazon and Meta now dominate new H-1B approvals, signaling a major shift in the visa landscape. This trend suggests a focus on retaining existing employees rather than bringing in new talent.

title: FM to move bill today for new cess on tobacco, pan masala
description: The government plans to introduce a new cess on tobacco and pan masala products. This move aims to prevent price drops after the GST compensation cess is phased out, ensuring these 'sin goods' remain costly. The proposed health and security cess will be implemented once notified, potentially before the compensation cess expires in March 2026.

description: The India U19 were struggling at 79 for five in 19 overs when a combination of rain and bad light stopped the play, and the match never resumed from that point

title: Police file chargesheet against Puran Kumar’s aide in bribery case
description: An exemptee assistant sub inspector, Sushil Kumar, has been charged in a bribery case linked to former Rohtak IGP Y Puran Kumar. Sushil allegedly demanded money from individuals involved in disputes, using the IGP's name. Digital evidence, including call records and transaction clues, supports the allegations.

While unconfirmed, the rumors have generated significant fan excitement for a potentially iconic, fairytale-like wedding weekend.

description: Philadelphia 76ers' star Joel Embiid is questionable for tonight's game against the Atlanta Hawks due to ongoing right knee management.  Having missed nine games, his availability hinges on pain management and on-court participation.  The Sixers, already battling other injuries, face a crucial test of depth as they aim for a win.

title: Cardi B and Stefon Diggs look so in love as they celebrate his birthday on Instagram
description: Cardi B delighted fans by sharing glimpses of Stefon Diggs' birthday. A custom Snoopy football cake, celebrating his jersey number, stole the show. Later, a video captured the couple joyfully rapping and dancing in a car, radiating pure, unadulterated fun. This intimate peek into their celebration resonated deeply, earning them 'relationship goals' praise.

Fans are embracing the public display of commitment, seeing it as a natural progression for the couple who have been openly dating for months.

title: Valkyrae controversy: Streamer clarifies viral resurfaced joke about wealth
description: Valkyrae clarified a resurfaced August 2025 clip where she joked about buying a fellow streamer's "entire bloodline." She described the remark as a "lame rich joke" that didn't land as intended and was taken out of context. The streamer emphasized the playful nature of the exchange and her immediate realization of how the isolated comment sounded.

The team's performance has led to speculation about a coaching change. Management has made no official announcement regarding Berube's future. The Maple Leafs recently secured a significant victory against the Pittsburgh Penguins.

title: Kevin Durant injury update: Will Rockets star play tonight vs Jazz?
description: Houston Rockets' star Kevin Durant is back for their November 30th game against the Utah Jazz after a personal absence. His presence is expected to significantly impact Houston's offense against a struggling Jazz squad.

description: The National Conference (NC) has reaffirmed its commitment to restoring Jammu and Kashmir's special status under Article 370 through a recent working committee resolution. This move aims to counter claims of the party abandoning a core issue and aligning with the BJP. NC also urged the Centre to restore full statehood to J&K as promised.

title: Important days in Dec : National and international dates to note for holidays, observances – details
description: Important days in December 2025: December marks a vibrant end to the year in India with national commemorations like Vijay Diwas and Kisan Diwas, alongside widespread Christmas celebrations. Regional festivals and tribal events highlight the nation's rich diversity. Globally, the month emphasizes crucial awareness campaigns on health, human rights, and environmental sustainability, fostering a spirit of collective responsibility.

title: Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy | Mhatre’s scintillating century sets up Mumbai’s dominant win over Andhra
description: The opener’s 104 off 59 balls and Tushar’s three-for does the job for the winning team; Samson’s rampage takes Kerala past Chhattisgarh

title: Two Gujaratis charged in $653,000 US gold bar scam
description: Two Gujarati men based in Chicago suburbs face felony charges for allegedly defrauding an elderly woman in North Kenosha of over $653,000 in gold. Prosecutors state this is part of an international scam where the victim was tricked into believing her savings were compromised. The accused are charged with money laundering and theft, with evidence suggesting overseas coordination.

title: Facebook friendship turns deadly: Woman jailed for NRI’s murder; motive linked to property
description: A woman has been sentenced to life imprisonment for poisoning and murdering an NRI man and burying his body. The victim, Raminder Singh Cheema, was lured to a rented house in Jalandhar, drugged, and robbed before being killed. His body was then buried to conceal the crime.

title: Two from Bihar arrested on charges of online fraud

Nearly 90,000 hectares of farmland submerged in Cauvery delta
description: Initial reports say standing paddy crop in Mayiladuthurai, Karaikal, Tiruvarur, Nagapattinam, Thanjavur, and Pudukkottai have been damaged due to rain caused by Cyclone Ditwah

title: ‘Pakistan module busted’: Three held in Delhi; plot to target Anmol Bishnoi uncovered
description: Delhi Police busted a terror-gangster module run by Pakistan-based Shehzad Bhatti, allegedly planning to target Lawrence Bishnoi's brother. Three youths, Asif, Hargunpreet Singh, and Vikas Prajapati, were arrested for executing grenade attacks in Punjab. Bhatti lured them with money and remotely coordinated operations, using social media to recruit disposable foot soldiers for public place attacks.

title: More than 300 Indians evacuated from flood-hit Sri Lanka, IAF provides assistance in rescue and relief operations

title: One arrested on charges of assaulting doctor’s assistant
Seth Curry returns to Warriors on 1-year deal, sparking reunion buzz with Steph
description: Seth Curry is rejoining the Golden State Warriors for the remainder of the 2025-26 NBA season, fulfilling the dream of playing alongside his brother Stephen. Initially waived due to financial restrictions, Seth was recently signed to a one-year deal, marking his first time sharing an NBA court with Stephen after 12 seasons and nine previous teams.

title: U.K. plans justice overhaul to prioritise victims by cutting court delays
description: Some hearings are listed as far ahead as 2030 and figures show more than a quarter of cases wait a year or longer, with many victims abandoning proceedings. In rape cases, 60% of complainants withdraw before trial

title: Palaniswami accuses Sengottaiyan of betraying AIADMK
description: Resuming his Makkalai Kaappom, Thamizhagathai Meetpom tour in Gobichettipalayam, he launches a scathing attack on the expelled leader and former MLA of the constituency, who joined actor Vijay’s TVK last week

title: 'My partner is half-Indian': Musk reveals on Nikhil Kamath podcast — 'son’s middle name is Sekhar'
description: Elon Musk revealed his partner, Shivon Zilis, is of Indian descent, with one of their sons' middle names being Sekhar in tribute to physicist Subrahmanyan Chandrasekhar. Zilis, who grew up in Canada after being adopted, is a key figure at Neuralink. Musk also commented on the changing landscape for Indian talent in America due to visa policies.

title: Chinnara Utsava witnesses participation of 430 children from 10 children’s care centres

title: Hyderabad scam: Telecallers to mimic Australian accent pull off Rs 10cr fraud; ex-students recruited
description: Cyberabad police busted a fake call center where telecallers mimicked Australian accents to scam citizens. The operation, which siphoned crores over two years, involved recruiting individuals familiar with Australia to gain victims' trust and banking details. The kingpins remain at large.

title: Gmail storage hack: How to keep inbox running smoothly - Check details
description: Running out of Gmail storage is a common issue, often exacerbated by connected Google services like Drive and Photos.  This article outlines practical steps to clear space, including emptying trash, deleting large attachments, and utilizing the Google One Storage Manager.  Adopting smart habits can prevent future storage problems and maintain optimal performance.

title: Thousands of Amazon employees send open letter to CEO; question layoffs
description: Over 1,000 Amazon employees have signed an open letter warning of dire consequences from the company's rapid AI development. They argue Amazon is sacrificing climate goals and its human workforce for AI dominance, citing increased emissions, water consumption for data centers, and job displacement. The workers demand ethical AI practices, including clean energy use and employee involvement in AI decisions.
